column14: To crouch or sit with knees bent and heels close to or touching the body.
column15: I squatted behind the crates to avoid being seen.

column14: To occupy an abandoned or unoccupied space illegally.
column15: They decided to squat in the abandoned building to have shelter for the night.

column14: A stringed musical instrument with a rounded body, commonly used in medieval and Renaissance music.
